description: Dive into "Melaka Mall Magic: A Shopper's Paradise" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Melaka Mall Magic: A Shopper's Paradise

places.generalDescription: Dataran Pahlawan Melaka Megamall is a sprawling shopping complex that offers a wide variety of local and global brands, dining options, and services. It is the largest mall in the area, catering to both modern and antique product enthusiasts at affordable prices. The modern structure appeals to international visitors and features diverse shops such as Perfume Avenue for fragrance aficionados. Situated near the historic A Famosa fortress, it provides convenient access to tourist attractions.

sources.snippet: Dataran Pahlawan Melaka Megamall is certainly the biggest shopping mall where you can get modern as well as antique products at affordable price and are reliable. The mega mall is structured in a modern fashion to accommodate the taste of foreign people and has a wide range of shops which includes, Perfume Avenue where those who have an addiction of sweet smelling potions can buy their heart content. Dataran Pahlawan mega mall has a lot of tourist landmarks nearby as well, so while one is visiting a local attraction there is no harm in looking around or checking stuff out to take home for beloveds.
sources.shortName: Best 5 must-visit Shopping Malls and Streets in Malacca ‚Äì MALAYSIA WORLD HERITAGE TRAVEL SITE

sources.snippet: A visit to this nine-storeyed shopping mall is must in your Malaccan day trip owing to the extra modernistic taste of the shops here in this mall. You will not only get the chance to enjoy the latest international fashion trends but also can enjoy the delicious Malaccan delicacies, watch a movie, or have a drink. Some of the international brands that you can find in Dataran Pahlaw are sprit, MNG, and Quiksilver along with Nichii and Padini which are the local brands.
sources.siteName: Visit Melaka 2025, Melaka Tourism, Malacca Tourism
sources.shortName: Top 10 Shopping Spots in Malacca

sources.snippet: Located beside the historical, Portuguese fortress A Famosa, this mall is the hub for the best of shopping in Malacca. From international brands like Bossini, Vans to handicrafts and souvenir stores, this is the shopper‚Äôs stop. It houses international brands, movie theatres, many entertainment centers, and the longest touch pool in Asia that is a touchable aquarium in the coral park where you can enjoy a closer view of underwater creatures.
sources.shortName: Shopping in Melaka - Where to Shop and What to Buy in Malacca

sources.snippet: The Dataran Pahlawan Mall in Malacca is surrounded by popular tourist attractions such as the Taming Sari Tower, A‚ÄôFamosa Fort and various museums. Hence, tourists visiting the area will most likely enter the mall as an escape from Malacca‚Äôs heat. Although its air-conditioners are a major factor for the crowd‚Äôs visit, this shopping mall boasts a great variety of shops, ranging from fashion apparel stores to F&B outlets and jewellery.
sources.shortName: 5 Best Shopping Malls in Malacca You Must Go

sources.snippet: Youngsters and youngsters at heart love hanging out at Dataran Pahlawan Melaka Megamall, the popular shopping place in Bandar Hilir. And now, the people behind the said mall built a new one that caters every shopper‚Äôs and foodie‚Äôs needs!. You‚Äôll surely love this as much as you love Dataran Pahlawan Melaka Megamall.
sources.shortName: 11 Reasons Why Elements Mall Should Be Your Newest Favourite Hangout Place in Melaka
11 Reasons Why Elements Mall Should Be Your Newest Favourite Hangout Place in Melaka

sources.snippet: Dataran Pahlawan has been around for around 10 years and it‚Äôs situated very strategically in town. The back of the mall is actually a row of schools including St. Francis Institution and Bandar Hilir School. The front of the mall is facing Mahkota Parade, and is connected to Hatten Square via a bridge.

sources.snippet: Dataran Pahlawan Melaka Megamall is the largest shopping mall in Malacca city. Besides, this megamall connects to Hatten Hotel, super easy for guests with indoor parking spaces some more. Moreover, you can reach the mall through an indoor footbridge, so no more sunburn!

sources.shortName: Top 9 Best Shopping Mall In Malacca City

sources.snippet: The historical Melaka doesn‚Äôt deny its visitor the pleasure to indulge in modern shopping. The Dataran Pahlawan Megamall in the Banda Hilir region has all the globally major brands and caters to shoppers across all ages.

places.name: Dataran Pahlawan Melaka Megamall

reviews.text: This is a shopping mall that occupies an enormous area and is only on two floors. All the shops facing the street have also entrances and exits via the street. Most of the brands are from Southeast Asia and are also found in most shopping centers in Malaysia. It is clean and there is a lot to discover in this gigantic area. It is air-conditioned and it is clean. Walking around in all different corridors was like going on a journey of discovery, a completely new experience.

Enormous shopping mall. Great place for shopping. But, should improve on their toilet, a lil bit smelly and dirty. The parking also less lighting, make it feel like i am on alleyway. Should improve in this to ensure the safety of the visitor.

Dataran Pahlawan Melaka Megamall
Address: Jln Merdeka, Banda Hilir, 75000 Melaka

Dataran Pahlawan Melaka Megamall is conveniently located in the heart of Banda Hilir and offers a decent selection of local snacks and quick meals at its small food court. However, the mall lacks a large grocery store, which can be inconvenient for extended stays or those needing everyday essentials. The dining and entertainment choices are relatively modest, and finding a parking spot could be frustrating. I found quite a long lower-floor alleyway with lots of interesting booths. The mall's design leans on the plain side, lacking the modern flair and lively atmosphere of more contemporary shopping centres. That said, it still serves well for a quick visit, whether after a simple snack, a casual browse, or just a place to rest your feet while exploring the city.

places.address: Jln Merdeka, Banda Hilir, 75000 Malacca, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: AEON MALL Bandaraya Melaka is a prominent shopping destination in Melaka, Malaysia. It offers a wide range of retail outlets, dining options, and entertainment choices. The mall frequently hosts exciting events and promotions, making it a popular spot for both shopping and leisure activities. Additionally, its strategic location near Zoo Melaka makes it an attractive destination for tourists. The spacious layout includes numerous well-known brands and a large supermarket section offering various products.

sources.snippet: AEON Mall Bandaraya Melaka adalah salah satu pusat membeli-belah yang terbesar di Melaka, menawarkan pelbagai kedai dan pilihan makan yang menarik. Dari kedai pakaian hingga pasar raya, pengunjung dapat menemui segala-galanya di sini. Mall ini juga sering mengadakan acara dan promosi menarik, menjadikannya lokasi yang popular untuk membeli-belah dan hiburan.

places.name: AEON MALL Bandaraya Melaka

reviews.text: We dropped by this mall for some shopping. The mall is large and comfortable with a wide variety of shops from food to apparel and department store. The mall was clean and felt modern.

AEON MALL Bandaraya Melaka

A lively and easy-to-navigate shopping mall with a great mix of stores and amenities. It features supermarket, department store, pharmacy, bakery, clothing and shoe shops, bookstore, cinema, gift shops, restaurants, and much more. The mall is clean, comfortable, and well-maintained, with spacious parking areas. Popular with both locals and tourists!

I visited this mall by chance as I took a longer walk along the river and wandered all the way up to this Aeon mall and decided to have lunch here. The mall is huge and plenty of different shops for shopping, but also excellent for dining, there's a lot of restaurant options as well as other shops for food and snacks.

A highlight would be the bakery, Verona Hills, that sells high quality bread and pastries. Definitely would visit this place again just for this.

places.address: 2, Jalan Lagenda, Taman 1 Lagenda, 75400 Malacca, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: The Mydin MITC Ayer Keroh shopping mall is a popular destination for shoppers in the area. There are many shops, including clothing and jewellery stores, restaurants, and convenience stores. The mall also has a food court with a variety of options for food lovers. There is ample parking available and the parking charge is only RM1.
places.name: Mydin MITC Ayer Keroh

reviews.text: I love buying groceries here, it's do big and you can find everything you need. Chocolate, fruits, bread, noodles, ice creams, dumpling, organic vegetables, everything. And the place is clean üòä

This is large mall located in the suburban area of Ayer Keroh, Melaka.

The mall generally serves middle and upper middle class customers.

The stores and stalls are numerous.  There are a few renowned tenants in the mall.

Cleanliness is good.

Facilities are well maintained.  Public washrooms are available.

Security measures are adequate.

The prices are reasonable here.  The tenants generally accept cash, e-wallet and credit card payments

Facilities for the handicapped are adequate.

There is a large car park available.  Numerous roadside parkings are also available.

This is my 2nd time going to mydin mitc on 20 august 2025. This time I was a bit disappointed when the weigher weighed the wrong amount, I bought a tougeh but barcode jering. I bought a labuh air But pumpkin barcode. I know when I get home

places.generalDescription: Freeport A'Famosa Outlet is a charming shopping center located in Alor Gajah, Malaysia. It offers a unique outlet concept with over 80 fashion, sport, and accessory brands at discounted prices. The architecture reflects Dutch heritage, creating a picturesque setting with fountains and a windmill for great photo opportunities. Situated near AFamosa Resort, it provides a relaxed shopping experience after enjoying the resort's activities.

sources.snippet: Another one of the premium outlets popping up in Malaysia, the Freeport A‚ÄôFamosa Outlet is about a 5-minute drive away from the A‚ÄôFamosa Resorts. After a fun-filled day at the resort, it‚Äôll be nice to do some shopping at a relaxed pace in Freeport A‚ÄôFamosa. The architecture of Freeport A‚ÄôFamosa contains elements of Dutch heritage, signifying its relation with the Dutch in the past.

Terletak berdekatan dengan A‚ÄôFamosa Resort, ia menawarkan suasana yang unik dengan kedai-kedai yang menampilkan pelbagai jenama terkenal. Pengunjung boleh menikmati pengalaman membeli-belah yang berpatutan sambil bersantai di kawasan yang indah.

sources.snippet: A Famosa Outlet Mall is ideal for those looking to shop or soak up the laid-back atmosphere. It is a charming shopping center with outlet stores, eateries, and a courtyard with fountains. You have got to visit this mall, and it‚Äôs a shopper‚Äôs dream come true!

places.name: Freeport A'Famosa Outlet

reviews.text:
Feeling ü•∞ with the rainbowüåà colour flower and lovely snake decorationüêçü©∑ü©µ
‚ô•Ô∏èthe red colour tanglungsüèÆüèÆ and wish this year safe travel all the way along with countless happinessüßßüßß Enjoyed the showüëèüèªüëèüèª

Been here before, few years back maybe 5 or years ago. It used to be better. It's another good example to demonstrate the importance of maintenance and proper maintenance. The outlet is ageing. Most of the shops in there need a major face-lift to demonstrate that it's a premium outlet. Washrooms are good indicator too.

We stop by this Outlet just by chance, as we were passing by on our way back from attending a wedding reception. Obviously, my wife just HAD to drop by...

The Outlet Building was only one floor, but sprawled over quite a huge area. The design seemed to be of Dutch Colonial themed or inspired, and they looked quite magnificent. I was impressed by the giant windmill located in the centre, which was a major attraction for the visitors. There was also a carousel or merry-go-round, but was not patronized somehow. Most visitors appeared to be contented to just sitting around, soaking in the festive atmosphere...

The Chinese New Year festive feeling was still in the air. Hence the patrons were mostly chinese families, who had come here as part of their holidays and celebrations. There was also a malay wedding ceremony happening at the Banquet Hall, with various mix of people attending the event.

Other than that, I didnt see much shopping going on, or maybe it was because the CNY sale was already over?

places.address: Jalan Kemus / Sempang Ampat, 78000 Alor Gajah, Malacca, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Leather Avenue, nestled on the ground floor of Malacca's historic Mahkota Parade shopping mall, is a must-visit for leather enthusiasts. This charming shop showcases exquisite leather products crafted by TOUGH Jeansmith, a renowned designer from Hong Kong. Visitors rave about the exceptional service provided by friendly and knowledgeable staff like Azahri, Aini, Shikin, and Azie. Their professionalism and attentiveness create a welcoming atmosphere that enhances the shopping experience.

sources.snippet: This shop is located at the ground floor of the oldest shopping mall in Malacca, the Mahkota Parade. Here, you will get the leather products designed by Hong Kong‚Äôs top leather designer, TOUGH Jeansmith.

places.generalDescription: Mahkota Parade is a laid-back retail center in Melaka, featuring specialty shops, fast-food eateries, and various activities like bowling. The mall has around 200 stores and over 1,000 parking spaces. It's popular among locals on weekends and holidays and also attracts tourists due to its proximity to accommodations across the road. This shopping destination offers discounted products from both international and local brands. Additionally, it hosts major community events and exhibitions while housing multiple international brands and entertainment centers.

sources.snippet: Located opposite the Dataran Pahlawan Mall, Mahkota Parade is another large mall with around 200 stores and more than 1,000 parking spaces available. Mainly visited by the locals on weekends and public holidays, Mahkota Parade is also frequented by tourists who are travelling around the area. Across the Syed Abdul Aziz Road, there are multiple accommodations such as homestays, hotels and guesthouses, which makes it convenient for tourists to visit the mall.
sources.shortName: 5 Best Shopping Malls in Malacca You Must Go

sources.snippet: Mahkota Parade Shopping Mall is another Melaka shopping mall which is best for shopping in Malacca; if you are planning on buying discounted products and hole the energy to bargain with the vendors as well. The shopping mall is one of a kind and one of the oldest that was opened in 1994, and accommodates dos2usb more than 200 stores in it. reviews.text: Mahkota Parade is overall a good shopping mall compete with many stores like restaurants, optical shops, money changer, shopping centre like Parkson, pharmacy and have Popular Bookstore in it. There's also halal sushi booths, Baskin Robbins, Famous Amos, Tony Roma's....very convenient as you can get everything you need in this mall. Lots of parking space too!

Mahkota Parade is a prominent shopping mall in Malacca City, Malacca, Malaysia. It officially opened on January 30, 1994, and underwent a major refurbishment before being relaunched on May 1, 2010.
Address: Lot B-02, Mahkota Parade, 1, Jalan Merdeka, Taman Costa Mahkota, 75000 Melaka
Phone: 06-282 6151
Floors: 4
During my stay, I visited The Handy Mall, which turned out to be a vibrant and bustling place. It featured a wide range of shops catering to most needs and a food court offering a selection of similar local dishes. One hidden gem was the Family Store supermarket in the basement. It was a bit tricky to find - access is via an escalator inside the Park's On Store.

Mahkota Parade feels like an old friend-familiar, dependable, and always ready for a visit. It's not the flashiest mall in Melaka, but that's part of its charm. You'll find a little bit of everything: books at Popular, a quick bite at Chicken Rice Shop, ice cream therapy at Baskin Robbins. The crowd is mixed-locals, tourists, families-all moving at a comfortable, unhurried pace. It's the kind of place where you end up buying more than you planned and bump into someone you know. Nostalgic, practical, and oddly comforting. Mahkota Parade holds its own.

places.generalDescription: Hatten Square, located in the heart of Melaka, is a trendy shopping complex with a vintage touch. This four-story mall offers a variety of international brands at discounted prices and is connected to other neighboring shopping centers. It's an ideal place for visitors looking for a compact yet well-equipped shopping destination with local and international products. Additionally, its prime location near UNESCO heritage sites and the luxurious Hatten Hotel makes it stand out among other attractions in the area.

sources.snippet: Hatten Square Suites Shoppes is a nice vintage styled but trendy Melaka shopping mall that has a lot of international brands in it which sell products at a cheaper rate than the international market. This mall is a four floored building that has just about everything and every souvenir that you would want to take back home for your family and friends. So, if you‚Äôre looking for a shopping complex which is not very huge but provides all the basic facilities to the shoppers and feature shops outlets that offers local products, Hatten Square lumion Suits Shoppes is the place to go.

places.name: Hatten Square

reviews.text:
I visited Hatten Square in Malacca last week for my Citiline shuttle service from Malacca to Singapore, and it was a very convenient and pleasant experience. The bus pick-up area had many different transport options, including luxury coaches, WTS, and other shuttle services.

Hatten Square is a great location for coach departures-very organized and easy to navigate. There are plenty of shops, shopping centers, and food outlets nearby, so you can easily spend your time while waiting for your bus.

Overall, it's a perfect departure and pick-up point for travelers, offering both comfort and convenience.

visited this place twice during 2023&2024, and it's basically a ghost town

Few shops such as MST, hefung, 711, hnm are open. The other storeys are vacant lol.

The only reason why people would be here is cause they are living at hatten hotel lmao
This mall has two floors.. nothing much to do there for me and there are nothing much in my favorite category but there is also a paranormic elevator which is nice.

reviews.text: Visited (tourist) on a weekday afternoon hence not crowded. Just how we liked it. Found this gem of a mall by chance! Amazing inexpensive clothing (t-shirts, ladies blouse, kids clothing, jacket, ... etc) & groceries. Food so & so if you're not that picky.

Surprisingly pleasant place with two floors stocked with F&B outlets, stores selling clothings and much more. We came here obviously for Jalan Jalan Japan for some treasure hunting, so was quite a pleasant place to browse around and kill time. Overall it was not bad, and there's ample parking space outside too.

(2023) New addition at the mall includes Jalan Jalan Japan. A pre-loved collection store with many interesting finds. ü§©üëçüèª

(2018) Good place for shopping. Don't forget to check out the handphone accessories shop located near the entrance. They have a wide range of products at good price but be mindful as some of the products are not original (hence the cheap price). Recommended buys are handphone covers, ranging between RM8 - RM20.

places.address: 3, Jalan Perindustrian Bachang Baru 3, Taman Bachang Baru, Batu Berendam, 75350 Melaka, Malaysia

sources.snippet: Melaka Mall merupakan pusat membeli-belah yang menawarkan pelbagai kedai dan perkhidmatan untuk memenuhi keperluan pengunjung. Dengan pelbagai pilihan kedai, dari fesyen hingga elektronik, pengunjung boleh menikmati pengalaman membeli-belah yang menyeluruh.
sources.shortName: Shopping Mall Best dan Popular di Melaka

places.name: Melaka Mall

reviews.text: Good Place For Boxing Competition and The Food Was delicious
Bad design, too many stairs to climb, elevators not often in operation. Super market though useful, messy and smelly. Parking very random

The Mall is quite big, anyhow there are less people and the retail shops are mostly closed. The location is very good infront of Aeon Air Keroh. The landed parking space is very limited, anyhow the parking place at the high level are a lot although there are free parking...

places.address: G26 & F31, Jalan Tun Abdul Razak, 75450 Melaka, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Plaza Hang Tuah in Malacca is a vibrant and popular spot, especially for the LGBTQ+ community. It's conveniently located near Hang Tuah Mall and offers a variety of unique gay-friendly venues. The mall itself provides diverse services such as phone shops, hair salons, remittance, and food stalls. Additionally, it's named after the legendary Malay warrior Hang Tuah and is situated close to the Hang Tuah monorail station.

sources.snippet: The best shopping mall for everything from handphones, hair cutting, remittance, and currency exchange to food stalls. It is named after the legendary Malay warrior Hang Tuah. Besides, it is located near the Hang Tuah monorail station.
sources.siteName: Private Car Hire Transport | Limo Taxi From Singapore To Malaysia
sources.shortName: Top 9 Best Shopping Mall In Malacca City

sources.snippet: Here comes Plaza Hang Tuah with currency exchange services, phones, and gadgets. In addition, if visitors are hunting for a new phone, they know where to go. A collective of brands like Oppo, Huawei, Vivo, and Samsung, all in one stop!
sources.shortName: 2024 Shopping Mall Guide List Malaysia

places.name: Plaza Hang Tuah

reviews.text: Good place to buy phones from a variety of stores. I think the whole plaza consists of a lot of different store selling phones. Real good spot though if considering getting a new phone or any other gadgets.
This is a wonderful shopping centre for all manner of handphone and electronic gadgets. The ground floor is fully occupied  whereas the upper floors are quiet empty.
old ass plaza, kinda sketchy but the shops look legit. lowyat kinda vibe eh

places.address: Plaza Usahawan, Jalan Hang Tuah, Kampung Bunga Paya Pantai, 75300 Malacca, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Dataran Pahlawan is a conveniently located shopping mall near Melaka's city center, making it easily accessible to top attractions and popular dining spots. It's just a short drive away from A Famosa Fort, Baba Nyonya Heritage Museum, and other must-see destinations. Additionally, the mall is close to a bus stop that provides easy access for travelers coming from Melaka Sentral bus terminal.

sources.snippet: Dataran Pahlawan merupakan destinasi membeli-belah yang ikonik di Melaka, terkenal dengan pelbagai kedai, kafe, dan pusat hiburan. Ia dikelilingi oleh bangunan bersejarah yang menarik dan menyediakan ruang yang luas untuk pelawat bersantai. Pengunjung boleh menikmati pengalaman membeli-belah sambil menjelajahi keindahan seni bina di sekitar kawasan ini.
sources.shortName: Shopping Mall Best dan Popular di Melaka

places.name: Dataran Pahlawan

reviews.text: A optimally located bus stop for whoever headed from Melaka Sentral bus terminal. Though do take note that this isn't the ‚Äúright‚Äù stop back to the terminal as it will take a huge loop back.
Great place
